metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6851 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
OpenJPEG through 2.3.1 has a heap-based buffer overflow inopj_t1_clbl_decode_processor in openjp2/t1.c because of lack ofopj_j2k_update_image_dimensions validation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u5build0.16.04.1').
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
texmaker: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.14').
